summary: REQ-1 is not implemented: the actor creation flow still calls initializeAccessControl() without handling the case where access control is already initialized, so actor initialization can still fail and prevent admin form submission. Additionally, an unrequested project_state.json file was added (and a large unrelated frontend-file-summaries.txt update appears unrelated to the requested minimal fix).

missing_requirements.requirement: Update the frontend actor creation flow so that if initializeAccessControl() (or _initializeAccessControlWithSecret(...)) throws because access control is already initialized, the error is handled and the actor is still returned/usable (so /admin form submission can call createForm without a "not connected to backend" error).
missing_requirements.reason: The updated actor hook still performs an unconditional `await actor.initializeAccessControl();` without any try/catch or conditional handling for the "already initialized" error case. This means actor creation can still fail if the backend reports access control is already initialized.

hallucinated_features.description: Added project_state.json tracking file describing the request and project metadata.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest does not request adding any project tracking/state files; it also constrains changes to only code strictly necessary to fix admin form submission.

hallucinated_features.description: Updated/maintained a large frontend-file-summaries.txt containing extensive UI/feature descriptions unrelated to the minimal actor initialization fix.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest explicitly disallows unrelated refactors/redesigns/new features and requests only the minimal code change necessary to restore admin-page submission; this summary content is not part of the requested fix.
